title: Malaspina Glacier, United States
description: Malaspina Glacier, segment of the St. Elias Mountains glacier system, west of Yakutat Bay in southeastern Alaska, U.S. The most extensive individual ice field in Alaska, it flows for 50 miles (80 km) along the southern base of Mount St. Elias, is more than 1,000 feet (300 metres) thick, and covers about 1,500 square miles (3,900 square km).
